props.header: Guided by Emory’s mission and values, Campus Life works closely with our students, faculty, and the entire Emory community to foster a nurturing, respectful, and rewarding campus environment.
props.text: Emory Campus Life is based on the belief that every member of our community deserves the highest standard of care and support. Through an array of programs and resources, we promote a healthy and sustainable environment where students live what they learn and discover what they live for. While the classroom will always have a fundamental role in shaping strong and empowered individuals, some of the most transformative learning experiences take place outside the classroom, from events and activities around campus to real-world opportunities.
We can play a significant role in cultivating an experience in Atlanta and beyond, that is about bringing those different perspectives to the forefront to solve our difficult issues.

props.title: Removing Roadblocks in 2036
props.body: Students’ financial situations should never affect their ability to learn and grow outside the standard classroom curriculum. 2O36 will support all students who wish to participate in three-month unpaid internships or other experiential learning opportunities. Not only will this initiative provide equal access to career development, it will also expose students to a variety of professional pathways and increase alumni satisfaction with career preparedness.
props.media_text: 2O36 will support all students who wish to participate in three-month unpaid internships or other experiential learning opportunities.

props.title: Rewarding Student-Athletes in 2O36
props.body:
It’s time for Emory Athletics to get its due. In the same way that the arts are an essential part of Emory’s culture, sports make an invaluable contribution to campus life for participants and fans alike. 2O36 will endow all 19 varsity sports, enhancing the student-athlete experience and reinvigorating school spirit and pride across the Emory community.

Armed with sustainable funding, coaches for every sport will be able to meet the changing needs of our student-athletes. Endowments will support customized nutrition plans and wellness programs and address the inherent challenges that are part and parcel of all college athletics, from transportation and equipment costs to stipends for assistant coaches. If we are serious about supporting the entire Emory community—and we are—student-athletes must be recognized as essential members and leaders of our community.

props.media_text: 2O36 will endow all 19 varsity sports, enhancing the student-athlete experience and reinvigorating school spirit and pride across the Emory community.

props.title: In 2O36, Students Are Global Citizens
props.body:
While our physical campuses will always remain the heart and soul of our community, Emory’s off-campus presence is more important than ever: across Atlanta, throughout the country, and around the world. Preparing students to become community leaders will be a key part of our future, but how can we accomplish this in an engaging way? How do we encourage Emory graduates to become agents of change? 2O36 will invest in global citizenship experiences designed to provide students with life-changing, real-world learning opportunities.

Tutoring K-12 students at an Atlanta public school. Registering voters in historically marginalized communities. Whatever piques our students' interests. We want them to engage with the world around them firsthand—to be ambitious but open-minded; eager for change but realistic about what it takes. With your support, students can make a direct link between the classroom and the community while learning how to listen, act, collaborate, and grow.

items.title: Centering Health and Wellness Through 2O36
items.description: As part of Emory’s commitment to the complete health of our student body, we’re creating new programs to educate students about the eight dimensions of wellness, including behavioral health, spiritual connection, emotional awareness, and physical wellness. These educational resources will strengthen academic achievement, personal growth, confidence, mental well-being, and social connection for the Emory community. 2O36 will support students’ health needs by increasing staffing and expanding clinical care, case management, crisis response, and preventative care. By training faculty and staff to identify and support students who need attention, we can create a more caring, campus-wide approach to positive mental health and emotional support.

items.title: Improving Life for Emory Student-Athletes With 2O36
items.description:
For student-athletes, even little improvements to their bodies and minds make a huge difference. Upgrading mental health and wellness resources on campus can upgrade their athletic and academic performance: a fueling station, better nutritional offerings, and sports psychologists. 2O36 will allow athletics administrators and coaches flexibility to meet the needs of current student-athletes. Your support can help pay for travel, post-season competition, training trips, nutrition, wellness activities, and advanced training equipment.

Funding also supports student-athlete’s personal and career development through our Eagle Edge Program, which addresses NIL (Name, Image and Likeness) usage, community engagement and leadership, and academic achievement.

items.title: In 2O36, Support is Everywhere
items.description: 2036 will allow Campus Life to expand program options, especially for students from underrepresented populations, both on an ongoing basis and in times of crisis. This includes meeting academic, medical, financial, and social challenges. Your help will allow every student, regardless of background, to flourish at Emory and beyond.

items.title: With 2O36, Deepened Student Engagement
items.description: Emory students deserve an experience that’s vibrant and fulfilling—one that they will cherish and want to continue as alumni. Investing in 2O36 will facilitate a range of community-building and class-year-based rites of passage, with a specific focus on campus activities. Movie nights. Concerts. Food truck festivals. Field trips to Atlanta landmarks. All these activities and more will preserve and expand Emory’s beloved traditions, leading to higher retention, graduation rates, student satisfaction, and alumni engagement.
